info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:42AM MST until December 14 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado today through tonight. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, Fort Morgan and Limon areas. If you are planning travel northeast, east or southeast of Denver today, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for blizzard conditions. Continued cold and very windy weather will continue behind the storm Wednesday into Thursday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Julesburg, and Holyoke. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Road closures and impassable roads are likely. Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
